results.title: Jindivik: the hunted one
results.creator_credit: Bewick Hack, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Supreme Film Studios
results.brief_description: The Jindivik is the remote-control target aircraft designed and built at the Government Aircraft Factory in Melbourne. The design has been upgraded during its 20 years of existence, and the latest version can be used to test guided missiles in a variety of target situations. Cinematogrpahy by Russell Boyd.

results.title: Jin-Roh: wolves in human armour [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Hiroyuki Okikura, Hidekazu Terakawa, Tsutomu Sughita and Bandai Visual Company
results.brief_description: An addition to the anime genre by the makers of “Ghost in the shell”, “Jin-Roh” is based in Japan ten years after World War Two. The cities are racked with fighting between terrorist groups and the police and the despised counter-terrorist unit. The film focuses on one of the counter-terrorists, Fuse, who fails to kill a young female suicide bomber when he has the chance. Fuse’s confidence is shaken after the event, however he tries to reintegrate himself into the unit. During this time he decides to try and find out about who the bomber was. In doing so he meets with the sister’s bomber who seems to value Fuse’s friendship. Behind this, the tension of the police and counter-terrorism unit comes to a head, with Fuse and the girl caught in the middle. The story of little red riding hood is used as a metaphor for many of the characters throughout the film. Fuse is torn apart as he sees visions of himself as one of the wolves, killing the bomber and her sister (who are depicted as little red riding hood). “Jin-Roh” keeps the audience in suspense as the story slowly unravels to reveal whether Fuse really is a wolf in human armour.

results.title: Jiminy Cricket's fabulous fables, fairy tales & other wonderful stories
results.creator_credit: Julie Jenkins, Kevin Riem, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Disney favourite Jiminy Cricket leads the viewer through the history of story telling, starting from Aesop’s fables and continuing through to Hans Christian Anderson and the Brothers Grimm. Stories include; THE TORTOISE AND THE HARE; THE GRASSHOPPER AND THE ANTS; OLD KING COLE; GULLIVER MICKEY; THE BRAVE LITTLE TAILOR; THE PIED PIPER OF HAMELIN; THE UGLY DUCKLING; LITTLE HIAWATHA; ELMER ELEPHANT.

results.title: Jim Jim requeim
results.creator_credit: Ken Newman and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: An animated story depicting the abduction of a young girl’s dog, by the North African Condor, Polly, that her grandparent’s have adopted. Music written and directed by Sue Johnson.

results.title: Jim Henson's the storyteller. Vol. 3
results.creator_credit: Jim Henson, Peter Smith, Steve Barron, Duncan Kenworthy, Jim Henson Productions and TVS Films
results.brief_description: Three folktales narrated by John Hurt featuring live action and characters created by Jim Henson. 1. “Soldier and death” A Russian story of a soldier with a magic sack who captures death and the resulting havoc it causes. 2. “Sapsorrow” A German Cinderella type tale of three sisters. 3. “True bride” A German story of a wicked troll mistreating his orphan servant Anya and a lion with magic gifts who helps her.

results.title: Jim Henson's the storyteller. vol. 2
results.creator_credit: Jim Henson, Jon Amiel, Paul Weiland, Duncan Kenworthy, Jim Henson Productions and TVS Films
results.brief_description: Three folktales narrated by John Hurt featuring live action and characters created by Jim Henson. 1. “The luck child” A Russian story of a seventh son and the power of prophecies. 2. “The three ravens” A German tale of enchantment by a wicked witch turning children into ravens and the spell broken by the king’s daughter being able to keep silent. 3. “Heartless giant” A German tale of a giant with no heart terrorising a country and the king’s son who befriends him and searches for his heart.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Henson, Jon Amiel, Paul Weiland, Duncan Kenworthy, Jim Henson Productions and TVS Films

results.title: Jim Henson's the storyteller. Vol. 1
results.creator_credit: Charles Sturridge, Steve Barron, Duncan Kenworthy, Mark Shivas, Jim Henson Productions and TVS Films
results.brief_description: Three folktales narrated by John Hurt featuring live action and characters created by Jim Henson. 1. “Hans my hedgehog” A German story about a cursed half-boy, half-hedgehog who can only be freed by loyal love. 2. “A Story Short” A Celtic tale of a storyteller who, if he fails to tell his king a story nightly for a year, will be thrown into a pot of boiling oil. 3. “Fearnot” A German story of a boy who does not know what fear is and attempts to find out.

results.title: Jim Gamble puppet classics
results.creator_credit: David Touster, Jonathan Bogner and Bogner Entertainment
results.brief_description: Jim Gamble has been making puppets for many years, including a period making puppets for Disneyland. In this series of delightful puppet plays he brings some of the most well-known children’s stories to life.

group_works.title: The Nutcracker
group_works.creator_credit: David Touster, Jonathan Bogner and Bogner Entertainment

results.title: Jhaoo Chowdhari: a Tongawallah from Delhi
results.creator_credit: Yavar Abbas and Gateway Film Productions
results.brief_description: Faces of India series. Shows intimate details of family life of a Delhi tradesman and of the district around his home. We see his wives and daughters occupied in housework and in caring for the all important horses, which pull the tonga which is Jhaoo’s livelihood. Also shows sacred shrines never before filmed. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Jewellery through 7000 years
results.brief_description: Pieces from Ancient Egypt, China, Sumeria, Greece, Celtic Europe and Byzantium, and examples of the Gothic Renaissance, Elizabethan and Art Nouveau styles are shown. Old techniques for working gold are demonstrated. Also refers to the superstitious, mythological, cultural and religious influences on jewellery design and usage.
